title: Can we please just
body:
Make it so Katarina's spin doesn't activate while she's under the effects of hard CC...

That doesn't seem to me like an unreasonable request?

So many times, you manage to stun her just before she kills you, and her mid-air dagger lands on her while she is stunned, she spins and she kills you. While stunned.

Like... lets not have that?

replies.body: so ccing something should halt the movement of something not tethered to it? is this what you're asking

yeah but there is a big difference between a dagger and a heimerdinger turret. I don't especially care about this suggestion but oriball gets disabled when she's cc'd, same with aurelion sol, whereas zilean bombs cannot be disarmed even by killing him, so I can understand it's hard to see consistency.

Aurelion Sol orbs and Ori's ball are not Autonomous

They are reliant on the Champion 

Zilean bombs are thrown out and then there are completely Autonomous. Zilean cannot interact with them at all. _(Throwing out a second one to cause a stun does not count, as when one is placed on the ground and another on a creepwave, the bombs stun when they come into contact anyway, meaning the stun mechanic is autonomous)_

Katarina daggers act like Zilean bombs, only the effect of them is performed by Katarina, so whilst CCing Katarina shouldn't remove the daggers, it should prevent her from using their effect, because when she picks them up its not the dagger doing the effect, but Katarina herself.
This ^
What about Azir? I mean, his soldiers are technically not autonomous, so he can use his soldiers during CC effects?

They aren't autonomous, but are like Ori's ball, they are always 'active' but need commands in order to function.

Hence they do still attack when Azir is under the influence of a taunt (because he is issuing attack commands).
And you can attack while silenced as a silence only stops you from casting, it doesn'[t break his connection with existing soldiers.

So yea, technically they do work under CC, you just cant issue commands to them while under the influence, so they cant do anything.

They work like I think Kat's daggers should do. They always exist, but cant be accessed while under certain CC.

something I really don't enjoy is how garen spin isn't disabled by polymorphs, tahm kench consume and he can still spin whilst using zhonias (last time I tried ap garen this really surprised me, I don't know if they've patched it).

Yea that is a little weird...

Polymorph stops things like Sol's stars, and other similar effects.

It'd be interesting to see if Rumble's flamespitter is stopped by polymorph, because I know it isn't stopped by Kench's eat.

Its not the 'movement' that should stop. Its the fact that she spins.
By all means let the dagger fall and she can pick it up as soon as she stops being stunned.

I see your logic, and agree that seperate entities like Zyra's plants, Yorick's ghouls, and Heim's turrets should work independently from the host.

But when you're stunned, pinned to a wall with a giant silver crossbow bolt. You are not physically able to catch a falling dagger and do a ballerina twirl on the spot. It just isn't done.

It makes less sense that she CAN still spin while stunned, than it does for her to not be able to spin.
hey I mean our boy garen can spin, regardless of stuns, polymorphs, tahm kench, zhonias and I think also bard ult.

I did not know this was a thing. That's dumb. If your stunned or disabled your champion can't take any actions. 

I can understand it working with roots that makes senses as does blinds. But all other cc should stop her from doing the spin. The dagger should keep going. But as the spin is part of her passive ability, she shouldn't be able to do it while stunned or silenced. That being said there are some other abilities that can be used while cc'd. Ez being able to acrane shift while blitz hooked for example.

I believe the other abilities (like Ezreal's arcane shift) are the result of how dashes/movement-abilities are coded to interact with CC.

When CCed while dashing (or performing the dash windup animation), you still perform the entirety of the dash, and end up in your new location under the effect of the CC. 

For example if Morgana catches Shen mid-dash with her Q, Shen will finish his dash, and be snared once he has landed.
_(the CC timer starts immediately on contact though, so morgana's Q is still timing down, while Shen is still dashing.)_

This is why Ezreal can escape Blitz pulls. Blitz pulls him during the animation of arcane shift. Ezreal shifts to his new location, but by then, the actual CC effect has timed out (its a pull, so it happens instantly on contact, and doesn't have a duration). So Ezreal isn't pulled back.

Im not sure I agree with how it works, but thats the way it does work.

The only exceptions _(to my knowledge)_ are Kalista's jump, and Yasuo's dash. _(Kalista's jump can even be slowed)_
Possibly Aurelion Sol's comet of legend as well. But that is cancelled on damage anyway, so its more likely that i'ts the damage causing it to stop rather than the CC effect.

I agree with all that and I know it's intended. But as far as I'm aware it's just Ezs that interacts like that with pulls. For instance Trists rocket jump can be hooked. Renekton can be hooked during his dash. It might work the same on Kassadin but I can't say I've ever seen it. Maybe it's cause I'm low elo, but the only time I've seen a blink or dash go off while being blitz hooked is An Ez arcane shifting

that's because ezreal shift is a blink, kassadin, lissandra,ekko, yi and katarina can also still dash if the timing is just right (maybe zed too since it's technically a blink, but I'm not sure), even when hooked.

Blitzcrank hook can disrupt most dashes but generally not blinks once the initial cast windup has finished. Technically tristana dash can also be used despite blitz hook even though it's a dash though for some reason and so it breaks the dashes/blink rule and there is a small frame where tristana jump can be used to 'negate' the hook.

I was so ready to say this but you beat me to it. Abilities like Ez's are basically a channel then an instant action, so as long as the channel/windup finishes the ability will go off, it's just for most champs the gap between channel completion and actual activation is a lot shorter, so for the most part they'd be interrupted or would not get hit at all.

Whereas abilities like Trist's are essentially one long channel that can be interrupted like any other (if you can manage to hit her with how wonky placement gets at such camera angles). Trist though seems to have a short windup, then a small gap/window of opportunity then the actual dash channel, but she's the exception there.

I fully understand why it works like that for blinks. And seras is probably right it's probably got something to do with the channel duration. But out of all those blinks you listed ez is the only one I remember seeing being hooked then blinking away. I have seen liss be hooked then blink to the claw once the hook finishes but that's just how the ability works. 

Your both right it's probably due to the channel duration. Most blinks would either dodge the hook or have the channel disrupted. Then again maybe it's just no one I play with had the understanding or ability to pull these off.

Now that you mention it, I have seen Trist's jump get stopped by pulls.
Hmmmm... that raises questions about Ezreal's thing then.

Ive played Kassadin for quite a while now, and I cant say i remember getting away from Blitz pulls in that way (but I'm not exactly the best Kass in the world either). So maybe it is just Ez.

If it is just Ez, i don't think thats very good. Things should be consistent.

This might be unpopular opinion, but could we not make an already clunky enough champion... Even clunkier? I'm fine with cutting her damage if they make her fool smooth to play. Nerfing her by making her feel like trash to play isn't the way to do it. Her kit as is, needs to be ridiculous to be relevant. There is a slight delay on her E (Say this isn't irrelevant, I've been hit by Yas tornadoes, then shunpoing to him and getting ulted. I've been on the other side of a lane while Warwick Ults me on the other side. It's ridiculous), the 1.25 dagger delay, the Q delay. All of it adds up for a high skill champ, that doesn't feel smooth to play. Picking up daggers doesn't entirely reset the E at low levels, leaving about a .5-1 second cooldown on it, which feels terrible too. I agree, her numbers are pretty high, but I disagree, that making her feel utterly terrible to play is the way to nerf her. I'd honestly rather Old Katarina.

I don't mean to be rude but.. 
God forbid we should have to deal with a free blink that has a 0.5-1 second cooldown for most of the game. It's such a shame that none of the other champs have to put up with such an inconvenience. Most of them have the pleasure of 14+ second dashes, that only go half the distance and don't do damage.

Its almost like other champs can't blink constantly around a fight, making it impossible for skillshot champs, dealing mega damage with every jump.

Play Kalista and then talk about delays on jumping.
Play Azir and talk about a high skillchap champ that doesn't feel smooth as silk.
Play Aurelion Sol, and then.... complain.. at all. 

Unlike so many champions, Kat is at the mercy of very very very few.

all champions deal with being CCed mid dash. On every champ except Kalista and Yasuo if you are CCed during the windup or animation of your dash the CC hits the champ, the champ completes the dash, and the CC continues to affect your champ after they land.
Im sorry to hear that in the 0.01 seconds that Kat has an animation for her instant blink, you got caught by a tornado. But the rest of us have to deal with that on a far more regular basis. 

If you think Kat is clunky, try playing some other less popular champions, you'll come back to Kat with a whole new outlook on life. 

So what would your solution be to her catching daggers mid stun?
It makes no sense that you can jump up, catch a falling knife, and spin around on the spot, while concust.

You say that her being unable to do damage while stunned would be "utterly terrible". How do you think everyone else gets by?

How would you resolve the problem?

I think you severely over estimate what she can do.

For a champion who can literally only output damage, who's biggest "instant" burst damage is dictated to the opponent where the dagger is going to land, and who's ultimate keeps her still for 2.5 seconds, she obviously needs some sort of mobility. If Katarina isn't jumping to the dictated dagger spots, she is losing huge amounts of damage and isn't getting the low cooldown Shunpo. If she is jumping to the daggers and people are standing around them, she setup right, and the enemy didn't react right. Hell, she has to jump INTO the enemy to hurt them (If she jumps back out, she's back onto the long CD, if she left her W there, she is missing out on alot of damage, if she W's in the middle of the enemy team, all she can do is hope no one notices her for 1.25 seconds and that they stay still). 

With this patches nerfs, her E at level 1 has a 4 second cooldown with a dagger pick, 14 without. For a champion who has to wait for delayed daggers to reach a spot, that's a massive gap.

Kalista was nerfed to the ground because she dominated pro play. Azir kinda the same, but I'm not really aware of any "smooth" issues on him. Aurelion well uhhh... Can't say anything there.

A champion doesn't have certain counters that absolutely ruin them? That'd be nice. These other champions you mention have other things in their kit other than damage. Yasuo has his defensive shield and windwall that blocks every single projectile in the game. Kalista well... Riot gutted her so, if she wasn't so gutted I'd say something here. 

It's a blink tho. And it feels dirty. 

I mained Zilean mid, have M7 on him, he feels more smooth than Katarina. I'll give it to you, Aatrox is absolute trash and very clunky to play. That's bad design on his part. Urgot well... They are reworking him. And then I'd argue the only real clunky part of his kit is the ult. 

My solution to catching daggers mid stun? Is it even an issue? If she's stunned you had time to walk away from the dagger.

I don't overestimate what she can do, i've had to experience it first hand many times.

The strongest thing about Kat, isn't her ridiculous damage, its the fact that you cant catch her. She can shunpo to any of 4 locations (2 daggers, you, or an ally minion/champion)

Predicting that is difficult, but whats harder is predicting the exact moment of her shunpo, and timing your CC to hit her. If you wait for her shunpo to land, the time it takes for you to launch your CC is enough tine for her to shunpo again.
You're also forgetting that she can Shunpo twice in battle with no consequences (what other champs get a damaging dash that can be used so often in battle.) and THEN after doing that she can still shunpo to safety if things get rough for her.

Yes its true that she can only do damage around her daggers, BUT the Q dagger is extremely heatseeking, even when she throws it on a minion, it still tracks exactly to where your champion will be when it lands. Plus the radius on the spin is so large theres very little chance to avoid it. 

She has the highest ban-rate in league, so its obviously not just me that finds her an issue to deal with.

Azir doesn't feel as smooth as you think, when you place a soldier you have to wait for the whole cast-animation to finish before you can even start the windup animation for an AA. When you use Q, the soldier needs to come to a complete halt and play the stopping animation before you can start winding up your AA again. If you have 2 soldiers active on the field, and you use Q, your soldiers track to each side of the aim point, so when you want to hit something at max range with your Q, you need 1 or 3 soldiers, if you have 2, tough luck.
When you want to dash, you cant just press your 'shunpo' button, you need to place a soldier, E in the direction of it, and in that millisecond before you hit the soldier you have to use Q to aim the dash to where you want to go. Thats 3 buttons and ALL of your regular abilities, and end up in your final location with everything on cooldown, just to dash any reasonable distance. (and that shit doesn't reset).

Im not saying all of that should be changed, if he could AA and dash instantly, he would be way too strong. Just like if Kat could Shinpo again instantly after landing on a dagger, she would be even stronger than she already is. Remember when LB could just doubletap her W and jump on you and back again instantly. Kat would just be able to do that. And riot removed that because there was 0 counterplay.

If you stunned her, you do have time to walk away from the dagger (although thats assuming you stunned her at the exact moment she threw it, and not while it was halfway down.) But when youve stunned a champion, thats your time to strike. No other champions have a free 'don't come near me when I'm stunned or you'll die' safeguard. and neither should Kat.

henlo very late reply but anyway:

By the time you reach a teamfight your e is on about a .3 cd with resets, but I'd argue that's pretty much essential to her kit. She'd be terrible if she couldn't dash in and out. Also err, if you've stunned her, walk in after she has spun and then go in really. As for the ban rate, I don't really think that's an issue. I honestly think that's more of a "I've seen things ban" as opposed to a "good ban". +her winrate has dropped to very close to 50% this patch. And her yeah some champions do have a free "don't come near me when I'm stunned or you'll die" safeguard. {{champion:103}} W (Not as bad), {{champion:85}} , {{champion:24}} , {{champion:62}} . +If she's stunned she can't  position the dagger spin optimally stuff like that. Kat has ridiculous but "broadcasted" mobility, and I think that's fine because... That's her shazam. You can see a kat dagger come over the wall, you can't see a kassadin full burst you over a wall. OVERALL I think I'm too biased for kat to be convinced she's too strong and I think you're the opposite. She's in a pretty healthy spot right now, this would just be unnecessary.
